intro: Braya calycina, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in early spring. Braya calycina is characterized by its low-growing habit and its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
